docblock.description: The entry point into the content repository.
docblock.long-description:
The Repository object is usually acquired through an implementation of the RepositoryFactoryInterface.

PHPCR Note: This interface has been simplified compared to JCR:

  • getDescriptor returns array on multivalue, single variable otherwise
  • removed isSingleValueDescriptor
  • removed getDescriptorValue and getDescriptorValues as ValueInterface has been dropped. Use getDescriptor to get the variable value.

docblock.description: The descriptor key for the version of the specification this repository implements.
docblock.long-description: For JCR 2.0 the value of this descriptor is the string "2.0".

docblock.description: The descriptor key for the name of the specification this repository implements.
docblock.long-description: For JCR 2.0 the value of this descriptor is the string "Content Repository for Java Technology API".

docblock.description: The descriptor key for the name of the repository vendor.
docblock.long-description: The descriptor returned for this key is a String.

docblock.description: The descriptor key for the URL of the repository vendor.
docblock.long-description: The descriptor returned for this key is a String.

docblock.description: The descriptor key for the name of this repository implementation.
docblock.long-description: The descriptor returned for this key is a String.

docblock.description: The descriptor key for the version of this repository implementation.
docblock.long-description: The descriptor returned for this key is a String.

docblock.description: Key to a boolean descriptor.
docblock.long-description: Returns true if and only if repository content can be updated through the JCR API (as opposed to having read-only access).

docblock.description: Key to a String descriptor.
docblock.long-description:
Returns one of the following RepositoryInterface constants indicating the stability of identifiers:

  • IDENTIFIER_STABILITY_METHOD_DURATION - Identifiers may change between method calls.
  • IDENTIFIER_STABILITY_SAVE_DURATION - Identifers are guaranteed stable within a single save/refresh cycle.
  • IDENTIFIER_STABILITY_SESSION_DURATION - Identifiers are guaranteed stable within a single session.
  • IDENTIFIER_STABILITY_INDEFINITE_DURATION - Identifers are guaranteed to be stable forever.

docblock.description: One of four possible values for the descriptor IDENTIFIER_STABILITY.
docblock.long-description: Indicates that identifiers may change between method calls.

docblock.description: One of four possible values for the descriptor IDENTIFIER_STABILITY.
docblock.long-description: Indicates that identifiers are guaranteed stable within a single save/refresh cycle.

docblock.description: One of four possible values for the descriptor IDENTIFIER_STABILITY.
docblock.long-description: Indicates that identifiers are guaranteed stable within a single session.

docblock.description: One of four possible values for the descriptor IDENTIFIER_STABILITY.
docblock.long-description: Indicates that identifiers are guaranteed to be stable forever.

docblock.description: Key to a boolean descriptor.
docblock.long-description: Returns true if and only if XML export is supported.

docblock.description: Key to a boolean descriptor.
docblock.long-description: Returns true if and only if XML import is supported.

docblock.description: Key to a boolean descriptor.
docblock.long-description: Returns true if and only if unfiled content is supported.

docblock.description: Key to a boolean descriptor.
docblock.long-description: Returns true if and only if full versioning is supported.

docblock.description: Key to a boolean descriptor.
docblock.long-description: Returns true if and only if simple versioning is supported.

docblock.description: Key to a boolean descriptor.
docblock.long-description: Returns true if and only if activities are supported.

docblock.description: Key to a boolean descriptor.
docblock.long-description: Returns true if and only if configurations and baselines are supported.

docblock.description: Key to a boolean descriptor.
docblock.long-description: Returns true if and only if access control is supported.

docblock.description: Key to a boolean descriptor.
docblock.long-description: Returns true if and only if locking is supported.

docblock.description: Key to a boolean descriptor.
docblock.long-description: Returns true if and only if asynchronous observation is supported.

docblock.description: Key to a boolean descriptor.
docblock.long-description: Returns true if and only if journaled observation is supported.

docblock.description: Key to a boolean descriptor.
docblock.long-description: Returns true if and only if retention and hold are supported.

docblock.description: Key to a boolean descriptor.
docblock.long-description: Returns true if and only if lifecycles are supported.

docblock.description: Key to a boolean descriptor.
docblock.long-description: Returns true if and only if transactions are supported.

docblock.description: Key to a boolean descriptor.
docblock.long-description: Returns true if and only if workspace management is supported.

docblock.description: Key to a boolean descriptor.
docblock.long-description: Returns true if and only if the primary node type of an existing node can be updated.

docblock.description: Key to a boolean descriptor.
docblock.long-description: Returns true if and only if the mixin node types of an existing node can be added and removed.

docblock.description: Key to a boolean descriptor.
docblock.long-description: Returns true if and only if the creation of shareable nodes is supported.

docblock.description: Key to a boolean descriptor.
docblock.long-description: Returns true if and only if node type management is supported.

docblock.description: Key to a boolean descriptor.
docblock.long-description: Returns true if and only if node and property with same name is supported.

docblock.description: Key to string descriptor.
docblock.long-description:
Returns one of the following RepositoryInterface constants indicating the level of support for node type inheritance:

  • NODE_TYPE_MANAGEMENT_INHERITANCE_MINIMAL Registration of primary node types is limited to those which have onlynt:base as supertype. Registration of mixin node types is limited to those without any supertypes.

  • NODE_TYPE_MANAGEMENT_INHERITANCE_SINGLE Registration of primary node types is limited to those with exactly one supertype. Registration of mixin node types is limited to those with at most one supertype.

  • NODE_TYPE_MANAGEMENT_INHERITANCE_MULTIPLE Primary node types can be registered with one or more supertypes. Mixin node types can be registered with zero or more supertypes.

docblock.description: One of three possible values for the descriptor NODE_TYPE_MANAGEMENT_INHERITANCE.
docblock.long-description: Indicates that registration of primary node types is limited to those which have only nt:base as supertype. Registration of mixin node types is limited to those without any supertypes.

docblock.description: One of three possible values for the descriptor NODE_TYPE_MANAGEMENT_INHERITANCE.
docblock.long-description: Indicates that registration of primary node types is limited to those with exactly one supertype. Registration of mixin node types is limited to those with at most one supertype.

docblock.description: One of three possible values for the descriptor NODE_TYPE_MANAGEMENT_INHERITANCE.
docblock.long-description: Indicates that primary node types can be registered with one or more supertypes. Mixin node types can be registered with zero or more supertypes.

docblock.description: Key to a boolean descriptor.
docblock.long-description: Returns true if and only if override of inherited property or child node definitions is supported.

docblock.description: Key to a boolean descriptor.
docblock.long-description: Returns true if and only if primary items are supported.

docblock.description: Key to a boolean descriptor.
docblock.long-description: Returns true if and only if preservation of child node ordering is supported.

docblock.description: Key to a boolean descriptor.
docblock.long-description: Returns true if and only if residual property and child node definitions are supported.

docblock.description: Key to a boolean descriptor.
docblock.long-description: Returns true if and only if autocreated properties and child nodes are supported.

docblock.description: Key to a boolean descriptor.
docblock.long-description: Returns true if and only if same-name sibling child nodes are supported.

docblock.description: Key to an integer[] descriptor.
docblock.long-description: Returns an array holding the PropertyType constants for the property types (including UNDEFINED, if supported) that a registered node type can specify, or a zero-length array if registered node types cannot specify property definitions.

docblock.description: Key to a boolean descriptor.
docblock.long-description: Returns true if and only if multivalue properties are supported.

docblock.description: Key to a boolean descriptor.
docblock.long-description: Returns true if and only if registration of a node types with more than one BINARY property is permitted.

docblock.description: Key to a boolean descriptor.
docblock.long-description: Returns true if and only value-constraints are supported.

docblock.description: Key to boolean descriptor.
docblock.long-description:
Indicates that you can change node definitions that are in-use by existing nodes

Note the typo of the value is also in JCR. see https://github.com/phpcr/phpcr/pull/43#issuecomment-8727677

docblock.description: Key to a string[] descriptor.
docblock.long-description: Returns an array holding the constants representing the supported query languages, or a zero-length if query is not supported.

docblock.description: Key to a boolean descriptor.
docblock.long-description: Returns true if and only if stored queries are supported.

docblock.description: Key to a boolean descriptor.
docblock.long-description: Returns true if and only if full-text search is supported.

docblock.description: Key to String descriptor.
docblock.long-description:
Returns one of the following RepositoryInterface constants indicating the level of support for joins in queries:

  • QUERY_JOINS_NONE - Joins are not supported. Queries are limited to a single selector.
  • QUERY_JOINS_INNER - Inner joins are supported.
  • QUERY_JOINS_INNER_OUTER - Inner and outer joins are supported.

docblock.description: One of three possible values for the descriptor QUERY_JOINS .
docblock.long-description: Indicates that joins are not supported. Queries are limited to a single selector.

docblock.description: One of three possible values for the descriptor QUERY_JOINS .
docblock.long-description: Indicates that inner joins are supported.

docblock.description: One of three possible values for the descriptor QUERY_JOINS .
docblock.long-description: Indicates that inner and outer joins are supported.

docblock.description: Authenticates the user using the supplied credentials.
docblock.long-description:
If workspaceName is recognized as the name of an existing workspace in the repository and authorization to access that workspace is granted, then a new Session object is returned. The format of the string workspaceName depends upon the implementation. If credentials is null, it is assumed that authentication is handled by a mechanism external to the repository itself and that the repository implementation exists within a context (for example, an application server) that allows it to handle authorization of the request for access to the specified workspace.

If workspaceName is null, a default workspace is automatically selected by the repository implementation. This may, for example, be the "home workspace" of the user whose credentials were passed, though this is entirely up to the configuration and implementation of the repository. Alternatively, it may be a "null workspace" that serves only to provide the method WorkspaceInterface::getAccessibleWorkspaceNames(), allowing the client to select from among available "real" workspaces.

Note: The Java API defines this method with multiple differing signatures.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The credentials of the user

tag.name: param
tag.description: the name of a workspace

tag.name: return
tag.description: a valid session for the user to access the repository

tag.name: throws
tag.description: if authentication or authorization (for the specified workspace) fails

tag.name: throws
tag.description: if the specified workspaceName is not recognized

tag.name: throws
tag.description: if another error occurs

docblock.description: Returns a string array holding all descriptor keys available for this implementation.
docblock.long-description: Both, the standard descriptors defined by the string constants in this interface and any implementation-specific descriptors. Used in conjunction with getDescriptor($key) to query information about this repository implementation.

tag.name: return
tag.description: a string array holding all descriptor keys

docblock.description: Determines if the given identifier is a standard descriptor.
docblock.long-description: Returns true if $key is a standard descriptor defined by the string constants in this interface and false if it is either a valid implementation-specific key or not a valid key.

tag.name: param
tag.description: a descriptor key.

tag.name: return
tag.description: whether $key is a standard descriptor.

docblock.description: Get the value(s) for this key.
docblock.long-description: If this is documented as a boolean property, this method returns a boolean, otherwise a string.

tag.name: param
tag.description: a descriptor key.

tag.name: return
tag.description: a descriptor value in string or boolean form or an array of strings or booleans for multivalue descriptors

docblock.description: A Version object wraps an nt:version node.
docblock.long-description: It provides convenient access to version information.

docblock.description: Returns the VersionHistory that contains this Version

tag.name: return
tag.description: the VersionHistory that contains this Version

tag.name: throws
tag.description: if an error occurs

docblock.description: Returns the date this version was created.
docblock.long-description: This corresponds to the value of the jcr:created property in the nt:version node that represents this version.

tag.name: return
tag.description: the creation date

tag.name: throws
tag.description: if an error occurs

docblock.description: Get the next linear successor version of this version.
docblock.long-description:
Assuming that this Version object was acquired through a Workspace $w and is within the VersionHistory $h, this method returns the successor of this version along the same line of descent as is returned by $h->getAllLinearVersions() where $h was also acquired through $w.

Note that under simple versioning the behavior of this method is equivalent to getting the unique successor (if any) of this version.

tag.name: return
tag.description: a Version or null if no linear successor exists.

tag.name: throws
tag.description: if an error occurs.

docblock.description: Returns the successor versions of this version.
docblock.long-description: This corresponds to returning all the nt:version nodes referenced by the jcr:successors multi-value property in the nt:version node that represents this version.

tag.name: return
tag.description: of \PHPCR\Version\VersionInterface

tag.name: throws
tag.description: if an error occurs

docblock.description: Get the next linear predecessor version of this version.
docblock.long-description:
Assuming that this Version object was acquired through a Workspace $w and is within the VersionHistory $h, this method returns the predecessor ofthis version along the same line of descent as is returned by $h->getAllLinearVersions() where $h was also acquired through $w.

Note that under simple versioning the behavior of this method is equivalent to getting the unique predecessor (if any) of this version.

tag.name: return
tag.description: a Version or null if no linear predecessor exists.

tag.name: throws
tag.description: if an error occurs.

docblock.description: Returns the predecessor versions of this version.
docblock.long-description: In both simple and full versioning repositories, this method returns the predecessor versions of this version. This corresponds to returning all the nt:version nodes whose jcr:successors property includes a reference to the nt:version node that represents this version.

tag.name: return
tag.description: of \PHPCR\Version\VersionInterface

tag.name: throws
tag.description: if an error occurs

docblock.description: Returns a snapshot of the node as it was at this version.
docblock.long-description: All properties are at under their original names except for uuid, primaryType and mixinTypes. The frozen node has his own uuid, and is of type nt:frozenNode. The original values at the time of the snapshots are provided as jcr:frozenUuid, jcr:frozenPrimaryType, jcr:frozenMixinTypes

tag.name: return
tag.description: a Node object

tag.name: throws
tag.description: if an error occurs

docblock.long-description:
• There already is a node in another workspace that has a checked-out node for the version history of N whose jcr:activity references A.
  • There is a version in the version history of N that is not a predecessor of N but whose jcr:activity references A.

docblock.description: The VersionManager object is accessed via WorkspaceInterface::getVersionManager().
docblock.long-description:
It provides methods for:

  • Version graph functionality (version history, base version, successors predecessors)
  • Basic version operations (checkin, checkout, checkpoint)
  • Restore feature
  • Label feature
  • Merge feature
  • Configuration feature
  • Activity feature

docblock.description: Creates for the versionable node at absPath a new version with a system generated version name and returns that version (which will be the new base version of this node).
docblock.long-description:
Sets the jcr:checkedOut property to false thus putting the node into the checked-in state. This means that the node and its connected non-versionable subgraph become read-only. A node's connected non-versionable subgraph is the set of non-versionable descendant nodes reachable from that node through child links without encountering any versionable nodes. In other words, the read-only status flows down from the checked-in node along every child link until either a versionable node is encountered or an item with no children is encountered. In a system that supports only simple versioning the connected non-versionable subgraph will be equivalent to the whole subgraph, since simple-versionable nodes cannot have simple-versionable descendants.

Read-only status means that an item cannot be altered by the client using standard API methods (addNode, setProperty, etc.). The only exceptions to this rule are the restore(), restoreByLabel(), merge() and Node::update() operations; these do not respect read-only status due to check-in. Note that remove of a read-only node is possible, as long as its parent is not read-only (since removal is an alteration of the parent node).

If this node is already checked-in, this method has no effect but returns the current base version of this node.

If checkin succeeds, the change to the jcr:isCheckedOut property is dispatched immediately.

tag.name: param
tag.description: an absolute path.

tag.name: return
tag.description: the created version.

tag.name: throws
tag.description: if jcr:predecessors does not contain at least one value or if a child item of the node at absPath has an OnParentVersion status of ABORT. This includes the case where an unresolved merge failure exists on the node, as indicated by the presence of a jcr:mergeFailed property.

tag.name: throws
tag.description: If the node at $absPath is not versionable.

tag.name: throws
tag.description: If unsaved changes exist on the node at $absPath.

tag.name: throws
tag.description: if a lock prevents the operation.

tag.name: throws
tag.description: If another error occurs.

docblock.description: Sets the versionable node at $absPath to checked-out status by setting its jcr:isCheckedOut property to true.
docblock.long-description:
Under full versioning it also sets the jcr:predecessors property to be a reference to the current base version (the same value as held in jcr:baseVersion).

This method puts the node into the checked-out state, making it and its connected non-versionable subgraph no longer read-only (see checkin() for an explanation of the term "connected non-versionable subgraph". Under simple versioning this will simply be the whole subgraph).

If successful, these changes are persisted immediately, there is no need to call save.

If this node is already checked-out, this method has no effect.

tag.name: param
tag.description: an absolute path.

tag.name: throws
tag.description: If the node at absPath is not versionable.

tag.name: throws
tag.description: if a lock prevents the checkout.

tag.name: throws
tag.description: If the checkout conflicts with the activity present on the current session.

tag.name: throws
tag.description: If another error occurs.

docblock.description: Performs a checkin() followed by a checkout() on the versionable node at $absPath.
docblock.long-description: If this node is already checked-in, this method is equivalent to checkout().

tag.name: param
tag.description: an absolute path.

tag.name: return
tag.description: the created version.

tag.name: throws
tag.description: if a child item of the node at absPath has an OnParentVersion of ABORT. This includes the case where an unresolved merge failure exists on the node, as indicated by the presence of the jcr:mergeFailed.

tag.name: throws
tag.description: if the node at absPath is not versionable.

tag.name: throws
tag.description: if there are unsaved changes pending on the node at absPath.

tag.name: throws
tag.description: if a lock prevents the operation.

tag.name: throws
tag.description: if another error occurs.

docblock.description: Check whether the node at path is checked out.
docblock.long-description:
Returns true if the node at $absPath is either

  • versionable (full or simple) and currently checked-out,
  • non-versionable and its nearest versionable ancestor is checked-out or
  • non-versionable and it has no versionable ancestor.

Returns false if the node at $absPath is either

  • versionable (full or simple) and currently checked-in or
  • non-versionable and its nearest versionable ancestor is checked-in.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The absolute path to a node the privileges shall be fetched of.

tag.name: return
tag.description: True, if the node identified by the given path is checked out, else false.

tag.name: throws
tag.description: if an error occurs.

docblock.description: Returns the VersionHistory object of the node at $absPath.
docblock.long-description: This object provides access to the nt:versionHistory node holding this node's versions.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The absolute path to a node the privileges shall be fetched of.

tag.name: return

docblock.description: Attempt to restore an old version of a node.
docblock.long-description:
If $absPath is given and $version is a version name: Restores the node at $absPath to the state defined by the version with the specified version name ($version). This method will work regardless of whether the node at absPath is checked-in or not.

If $absPath is given and $version is a VersionInterface instance: Restores the specified version to $absPath. There must be no existing node at $absPath. If one exists, a VersionException is thrown. There must be a parent node to the location at $absPath, otherwise a PathNotFoundException is thrown. If the would-be parent of the location $absPath is actually a property, or if a node type restriction would be violated, then a ConstraintViolationException is thrown.

If $version is VersionInterface instance: Restores the node in the current workspace that is the versionable node of the specified version to the state reflected in that version. This method ignores checked-in status.

If $version is an array of VersionInterface instances: Restores a set of versions at once. Used in cases where a "chicken and egg" problem of mutually referring REFERENCE properties would prevent the restore in any serial order. The following restrictions apply to the set of versions specified: If S is the set of versions being restored simultaneously, - For every version V in S that corresponds to a missing node, there must also be a parent of V in S. - S must contain at least one version that corresponds to an existing node in the workspace. - No V in S can be a root version (jcr:rootVersion). If any of these restrictions does not hold, the restore will fail because the system will be unable to determine the path locations to which one or more versions are to be restored. In this case a VersionException is thrown. The versionable nodes in the current workspace that correspond to the versions being restored define a set of (one or more) subgraphs.

If the restore succeeds the changes made are dispatched immediately; there is no need to call save.

If an array of VersionInterface instances is restored, an identifier collision occurs when the current workspace contains a node outside these subgraphs that has the same identifier as one of the nodes that would be introduced by the restore operation into one of these subgraphs. Else, an identifier collision occurs when a node exists outside the subgraph rooted at absPath with the same identifier as a node that would be introduced by the restore operation into the affected subgraph. The result in such a case is governed by the removeExisting flag. If $removeExisting is true, then the incoming node takes precedence, and the existing node (and its subgraph) is removed (if possible; otherwise a RepositoryException is thrown). If $removeExisting is false, then an ItemExistsException is thrown and no changes are made. Note that this applies not only to cases where the restored node itself conflicts with an existing node but also to cases where a conflict occurs with any node that would be introduced into the workspace by the restore operation. In particular, conflicts involving subnodes of the restored node that have OnParentVersion settings of COPY or VERSION are also governed by the $removeExisting flag.

Note: The Java API defines this with multiple differing signatures, you need to act accordingly in your implementation.

tag.name: param
tag.description: a boolean flag that governs what happens in case of an identifier collision

tag.name: param
tag.description: a version name, an an array of Version objects or a Version object

tag.name: param
tag.description: The absolute path to a node the privileges shall be fetched of.

tag.name: throws
tag.description: if the specified version does not have a corresponding node in the workspace this VersionManager has been created for or if an attempt is made to restore the root version (jcr:rootVersion).

tag.name: throws
tag.description: if $removeExisting is false and an identifier collision occurs or a node exists at $absPath.

tag.name: throws
tag.description: if this Session has pending unsaved changes.

tag.name: throws
tag.description: if versioning is not supported.

tag.name: throws
tag.description: if a lock prevents the restore.

tag.name: throws
tag.description: if another error occurs.

docblock.description: Restores the version of the node at absPath with the specified version label.
docblock.long-description:
If this node is not versionable, an UnsupportedRepositoryOperationException is thrown. If successful, the change is persisted immediately and there is no need to call save.

This method will work regardless of whether the node at absPath is checked-in or not.

An identifier collision occurs when a node exists outside the subgraph rooted at this node with the same identifier as a node that would be introduced by the restoreByLabel operation into the subgraph at this node. The result in such a case is governed by the removeExisting flag. If removeExisting is true, then the incoming node takes precedence, and the existing node (and its subgraph) is removed (if possible; otherwise a RepositoryException is thrown). If removeExisting is false, then a ItemExistsException is thrown and no changes are made. Note that this applies not only to cases where the restored node itself conflicts with an existing node but also to cases where a conflict occurs with any node that would be introduced into the workspace by the restore operation. In particular, conflicts involving subnodes of the restored node that have OnParentVersion settings of COPY or VERSION are also governed by the removeExisting flag.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The absolute path to a node the privileges shall be fetched of.

tag.name: param
tag.description: a String

tag.name: param
tag.description: a boolean flag that governs what happens in case of an identifier collision.

tag.name: throws
tag.description: if the node at absPath is not versionable.

tag.name: throws
tag.description: if the specified versionLabel does not exist in this node's version history.

tag.name: throws
tag.description: if removeExisting is false and an identifier collision occurs.

tag.name: throws
tag.description: if a lock prevents the restore.

tag.name: throws
tag.description: if this Session (not necessarily the Node at absPath) has pending unsaved changes.

tag.name: throws
tag.description: If another error occurs.

docblock.description: If an nt:activity Node is given:
docblock.long-description:
This method merges the changes that were made under the specified activity into the current workspace.

An activity A will be associated with a set of versions through the jcr:activity reference of each version node in the set. We call each such associated version a member of A.

For each version history H that contains one or more members of A, one such member will be the latest member of A in H. The latest member of A in H is the version in H that is a member of A and that has no successor versions (to any degree) that are also members of A.

The set of versions that are the latest members of A in their respective version histories is called the change set of A. It fully describes the changes made under the activity A.

This method performs a shallow merge into the current workspace of each version in the change set of the activity specified by activityNode. If there is no corresponding node in this workspace for a given member of the change set, that member is ignored.

If an absolute path is given:

This method can be thought of as a version-sensitive update.

If isShallow is true, it tests the node at absPath against its corresponding node in srcWorkspace with respect to the relation between their respective base versions and either updates the node in question or not, depending on the outcome of the test.

If isShallow is false, this method recursively tests each versionable node in the subgraph as mentioned above.

If isShallow is true and this node is not versionable, then this method returns and no changes are made.

A MergeException is thrown if bestEffort is false and a versionable node is encountered whose corresponding node's base version is on a divergent branch from the base version of the node at absPath.

This is a worksapce-write method and therefore any changes are dispatched immediately.

This method returns an iterator over all versionable nodes in the subgraph that received a merge result of fail. If bestEffort is false, this iterator will be empty (since if merge returns successfully, instead of throwing an exception, it will be because no failures were encountered). If bestEffort is true, this iterator will contain all nodes that received a fail during the course of this merge operation.

See the JCR specifications for more details on the behavior of this method.

Note: The Java API defines this with multiple differing signatures.

tag.name: param
tag.description: an absolute path or an nt:activity node.

tag.name: param
tag.description: the name of the source workspace (optional if $source is a Node).

tag.name: param
tag.description: a boolean (optional if $source is a Node)

tag.name: param
tag.description: a boolean (optional)

tag.name: return
tag.description: implementing SeekableIterator and Countable. Keys are the Node names, values the corresponding NodeInterface instances that received a merge result of "fail" in the course of this operation.

tag.name: throws
tag.description: - if bestEffort is false and a failed merge result is encountered.

tag.name: throws
tag.description: if this session (not necessarily the node at absPath) has pending unsaved changes.

tag.name: throws
tag.description: if srcWorkspace does not exist.

tag.name: throws
tag.description: if the current session does not have sufficient rights to perform the operation.

tag.name: throws
tag.description: if a lock prevents the merge.

tag.name: throws
tag.description: if the specified node is not an nt:activity node.

tag.name: throws
tag.description: if this operation is not supported by this implementation.

tag.name: throws
tag.description: if another error occurs.

docblock.description: Completes the merge process with respect to the node at absPath and the specified version.
docblock.long-description:
When the merge(string, string, boolean) method is called on a node, every versionable node in that subgraph is compared with its corresponding node in the indicated other workspace and a "merge test result" is determined indicating one of the following:

  1. This node will be updated to the state of its correspondee (if the base version of the correspondee is more recent in terms of version history)
  2. This node will be left alone (if this node's base version is more recent in terms of version history).
  3. This node will be marked as having failed the merge test (if this node's base version is on a different branch of the version history from the base version of its corresponding node in the other workspace, thus preventing an automatic determination of which is more recent).

(See merge() for more details)

In the last case the merge of the non-versionable subgraph (the "content") of this node must be done by the application (for example, by providing a merge tool for the user).

Additionally, once the content of the nodes has been merged, their version graph branches must also be merged. The JCR versioning system provides for this by keeping a record, for each versionable node that fails the merge test, of the base version of the corresponding node that caused the merge failure. This record is kept in the jcr:mergeFailed property of this node. After a merge, this property will contain one or more (if multiple merges have been performed) REFERENCEs that point to the "offending versions".

To complete the merge process, the client calls doneMerge(Version v) passing the version object referred to be the jcr:mergeFailed property that the client wishes to connect to this node in the version graph. This has the effect of moving the reference to the indicated version from the jcr:mergeFailed property of this node to the jcr:predecessors.

If the client chooses not to connect this node to a particular version referenced in the jcr:mergeFailed property, he calls cancelMerge(String, Version). This has the effect of removing the reference to the specified version from jcr:mergeFailed without adding it to jcr:predecessors.

Once the last reference in jcr:mergeFailed has been either moved to jcr:predecessors (with doneMerge) or just removed from jcr:mergeFailed (with cancelMerge) the jcr:mergeFailed property is automatically removed, thus enabling this node to be checked-in, creating a new version (note that before the jcr:mergeFailed is removed, its OnParentVersion setting of ABORT prevents checkin). This new version will have a predecessor connection to each version for which doneMerge was called, thus joining those branches of the version graph.

If successful, these changes are dispatched immediately, there is no need to call save.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The absolute path to a node the privileges shall be fetched of.

tag.name: param
tag.description: a version referred to by the jcr:mergeFailed property of the node at absPath.

tag.name: throws
tag.description: if the version specified is not among those referenced in this node's jcr:mergeFailed or if the node is currently checked-in.

tag.name: throws
tag.description: if there are unsaved changes pending on the node at absPath.

tag.name: throws
tag.description: if the node at absPath is not versionable.

tag.name: throws
tag.description: if another error occurs.

docblock.description: Cancels the merge process with respect to the node at absPath and the specified version.
docblock.long-description:
See doneMerge(string, Version) for a full explanation. Also see merge(string, string, boolean) for more details.

If successful, these changes are dispatched immediately, there is no need to call save.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The absolute path to a node the privileges shall be fetched of.

tag.name: param

tag.name: throws
tag.description: if the version specified is not among those referenced in the jcr:mergeFailed property of the node at absPath or if the node is currently checked-in.

tag.name: throws
tag.description: there are unsaved changes pending on the node at absPath.

tag.name: throws
tag.description: the node at absPath is not versionable.

tag.name: throws
tag.description: if another error occurs.

docblock.description: Calling createConfiguration on the node N at absPath creates, in the configuration storage, a new nt:configuration node whose root is N.
docblock.long-description:
A reference to N is recorded in the jcr:root property of the new configuration, and a reference to the new configuration is recorded in the jcr:configuration property of N.

If the specified baseline is null, a new version history is created to store baselines of the new configuration, and the jcr:baseVersion of the new configuration references the root of the new version history. If the specified baseline is not null, the jcr:baseVersion of the new configuration references the specified baseline.

The changes are persisted immediately, a save is not required.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The absolute path to a node the privileges shall be fetched of.

tag.name: param
tag.description: a Version

tag.name: return
tag.description: a new nt:configuration node

tag.name: throws
tag.description: if N is not versionable.

tag.name: throws
tag.description: if another error occurs.

docblock.long-description: Changing the current activity is done by calling setActivity again. Cancelling the current activity (so that the session has no current activity) is done by calling setActivity(null). The activity Node is returned.

docblock.long-description:
The repository may, but is not required to, use the title as a hint for what to name the new activity node. The new activity Node is returned.

The new node is dispatched immediately and does not require a save.

docblock.description: A VersionHistory object wraps an nt:versionHistory node.
docblock.long-description:
It provides convenient access to version history information.

Note: As this extends NodeInterface, foreach still iterates over the children and not over versions. If you want to use a foreach, you can use getAllVersions() to retrieve an iterator over versions.

docblock.description: Returns the identifier of the versionable node for which this is the version history.

tag.name: return
tag.description: the identifier of the versionable node for which this is the version history.

tag.name: throws
tag.description: if an error occurs.

docblock.description: Returns the root version of this version history.

tag.name: return
tag.description: a Version object.

tag.name: throws
tag.description: if an error occurs.

docblock.description: This method returns an iterator over all the versions in the line of descent from the root version to that base version within this history that is bound to the workspace through which this VersionHistory was accessed.
docblock.long-description:
Within a version history H, B is the base version bound to workspace W if and only if there exists a versionable node N in W whose version history is H and B is the base version of N.

The line of descent from version V1 to V2, where V2 is a successor of V1, is the ordered list of versions starting with V1 and proceeding through each direct successor to V2.

The versions are returned in order of creation date, from oldest to newest.

Note that in a simple versioning repository the behavior of this method is equivalent to returning all versions in the version history in order from oldest to newest.

tag.name: return
tag.description: implementing SeekableIterator and Countable. Values are the VersionInterface instances. Keys are the version names.

tag.name: throws
tag.description: if an error occurs.

docblock.description: Returns an iterator over all the versions within this version history.
docblock.long-description: If the version graph of this history is linear then the versions are returned in order of creation date, from oldest to newest. Otherwise the order of the returned versions is implementation-dependent.

tag.name: return
tag.description: implementing SeekableIterator and Countable. Values are the VersionInterface instances. Keys are the version names.

tag.name: throws
tag.description: if an error occurs.

docblock.description: This method returns all the frozen nodes of all the versions in this verison history in the same order as getAllLinearVersions().

tag.name: return
tag.description: implementing SeekableIterator and Countable. Values are the NodeInterface instances. Keys are the version names

tag.name: throws
tag.description: if an error occurs.

docblock.description: Returns an iterator over all the frozen nodes of all the versions of this version history.
docblock.long-description: Under simple versioning the order of the returned nodes will be the order of their creation. Under full versioning the order is implementation-dependent.

tag.name: return
tag.description: implementing SeekableIterator and Countable. Values are the NodeInterface instances. Keys are the version names

tag.name: throws
tag.description: if an error occurs.

docblock.description: Retrieves a particular version from this version history by version name.

tag.name: param
tag.description: a version name

tag.name: return
tag.description: a Version object.

tag.name: throws
tag.description: if the specified version is not in this version history.

tag.name: throws
tag.description: if an error occurs.

docblock.description: Retrieves a particular version from this version history by version label.

tag.name: param
tag.description: a version label

tag.name: return
tag.description: a Version object.

tag.name: throws
tag.description: if the specified label is not in this version history.

tag.name: throws
tag.description: if an error occurs.

docblock.description: Adds the specified label to the specified version.
docblock.long-description:
The label must be a JCR name in either qualified or extended form and therefore must conform to the syntax restriction that apply to such names. In particular a colon (:) should not be used unless it is intended as a prefix delimiter in a qualified name.

Adding a version label to a version corresponds to adding a reference property with a name specified by the label parameter to the jcr:versionLabels sub node of the nt:versionHistory node. The reference property points to the nt:version node that represents the specified version.

This is a workspace-write method and therefore the change is made immediately.

Within a particular version history, a given label may appear a maximum of once. If the specified label is already assigned to a version in this history and moveLabel is true then the label is removed from its current location and added to the version with the specified versionName. If m oveLabel is false, then an attempt to add a label that already exists will fail.

A VersionException is thrown if the named version is not in this VersionHistory or if it is the root version (jcr:rootVersion) or if the label specified is not a valid JCR NAME.

tag.name: param
tag.description: the name of the version to which the label is to be added.

tag.name: param
tag.description: the label to be added, a JCR name in either extended or qualified form.

tag.name: param
tag.description: if true, then if label is already assigned to a version in this version history, it is moved to the new version specified; if false, then attempting to assign an already used label will throw a LabelExistsVersionException.

tag.name: throws
tag.description: if moveLabel is false, and an attempt is made to add a label that already exists in this version history

tag.name: throws
tag.description: if the specified version does not exist in this version history or if the specified version is the root version (jcr:rootVersion).

tag.name: throws
tag.description: if another error occurs.

docblock.description: Removes the specified label from among the labels of this version history.
docblock.long-description:
The label must be a JCR name in either qualified or extended form. This corresponds to removing a property from the jcr:versionLabels child node of the nt:versionHistory node that represents this version history.

This is a workspace-write method and therefore the change is made immediately.

tag.name: param
tag.description: a version label. A JCR name in either extended or qualified form.

tag.name: throws
tag.description: if the name label does not exist in this version history.

tag.name: throws
tag.description: if another error occurs.

docblock.description: Returns true if the given version has the given label.
docblock.long-description:
If no $version is given returns true if any version in the history has the given label.

The label must be a JCR name in either qualified or extended form.

PHPCR Note: The Java API defines this with multiple differing signatures.

tag.name: param
tag.description: a version label. A JCR name in either extended or qualified form.

tag.name: param
tag.description: a Version object

tag.name: return
tag.description: a boolean.

tag.name: throws
tag.description: if the specified version is not of this version history.

tag.name: throws
tag.description: if another error occurs.

docblock.description: Returns all version labels of the given version - empty array if none.
docblock.long-description:
If a $version is given returns all version labels of the history or an empty array if there are none.

Note: The Java API defines this with multiple differing signatures.

tag.name: param
tag.description: a Version object

tag.name: return
tag.description: a string array containing all the labels of the (given) version (history)

tag.name: throws
tag.description: if the specified version is not in this version history.

tag.name: throws
tag.description: if another error occurs.

docblock.description: Removes the named version from this version history and automatically repairs the version graph.
docblock.long-description:
If the version to be removed is V, V's predecessor set is P and V's successor set is S, then the version graph is repaired s follows:

  • For each member of P, remove the reference to V from its successor list and add references to each member of S.
  • For each member of S, remove the reference to V from its predecessor list and add references to each member of P.

Note that this change is made immediately; there is no need to call save. In fact, since the the version storage is read-only with respect to normal repository methods, save does not even function in this context.

tag.name: param
tag.description: the name of a version in this version history.

tag.name: throws
tag.description: if the specified version is currently the target of a REFERENCE property elsewhere in the repository (not necessarily in this workspace) and the current Session has read access to that REFERENCE property.

tag.name: throws
tag.description: if the current Session does not have permission to remove the specified version or if the specified version is currently the target of a REFERENCE property elsewhere in the repository (not just in this workspace) and the current Session does not have read access to that REFERENCE property.

tag.name: throws
tag.description: if this operation is not supported by the implementation.

tag.name: throws
tag.description: if the named version is not in this version history.

tag.name: throws
tag.description: if another error occurs.

docblock.description: The possible actions specified by the onParentVersion attribute in a property definition within a node type definition.
docblock.long-description:
This interface defines the following actions:

  • COPY
  • VERSION
  • INITIALIZE
  • COMPUTE
  • IGNORE
  • ABORT

Every item (node or property) in the repository has a status indicator that governs what happens to that item when its parent node is versioned. This status is defined by the onParentVersion attribute in the PropertyDefinition or NodeDefinition that applies to the item in question.

tag.name: author
tag.description: Karsten Dambekalns <karsten@typo3.org>

docblock.description: The COPY action constant.
The VERSION action constant.
The INITIALIZE action constant.
The COMPUTE action constant.
The IGNORE action constant.
The ABORT action constant.
The name of the COPY on-version action, as used in serialization.
The name of the VERSION on-version action, as used in serialization.
The name of the INITIALIZE on-version action, as used in serialization.
The name of the COMPUTE on-version action, as used in serialization.
The name of the IGNORE on-version action, as used in serialization.
The name of the ABORT on-version action, as used in serialization.
Make instantiation impossible.
Returns the name of the specified action, as used in serialization.

tag.name: param
tag.description: the on-version action

tag.name: return
tag.description: the name of the specified action

docblock.description: Returns the numeric constant value of the on-version action with the specified name.

tag.name: param

docblock.long-description: This exception shall be thrown by the deserialization methods of Session if the serialized data being input has an invalid format.
